intro: Ceradenia meridensis, commonly known as the Andean sun orchid, is a rare orchid species native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow and green floral structure. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are notable for their intricate patterns and are often pollinated by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Ceradenia meridensis is considered a vulnerable species.
